item.title: May 20 is Going to Be a Super Busy Day for PlayStation Plus
item.description:
Summary

  • On May 20, new games will be added for PS Plus Extra/Premium subscribers, while others like Grand Theft Auto 5 will leave.
  • The Premium tier will receive Battle Engine Aquila, offering classic mech action gameplay.
  • June 2025's free PS Plus games are expected to be revealed around May 28, with access likely starting on June 3.

May 20 is looking to be a very busy day for PlayStation Plus , as many games will be both entering and leaving the subscription service catalog. On that day, a number of new games will be added to the game catalog available to PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium-tier subscribers, while other titles will leave and become inaccessible to those who don't opt to purchase them separately.

To keep PlayStation Plus subscribers tuned in to the service's offerings, Sony staggers out updates to the game catalog throughout each month. For players at the PS Plus Essential tier, the May 2025 free PS Plus games were made available on May 6, including Balatro, Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun , and Ark: Survival Ascended . Players at the more expensive Extra and Premium tiers have to wait until the middle of the month to see what they're getting in terms of game catalog updates, free trials, and premium game streaming.

PS Plus Extra and Premium subscribers will be getting a mix of recent and high-end titles with a lot of play potential. Not only are subscribers getting access to the World War 2-themed Battlefield 5 , but they're also getting Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising , the updated edition of the popular Arc System Works fighting game. Sand Land is a sci-fi action RPG based on a series by the late Dragon Ball creator Akira Toriyama, while the beloved early STALKER games are collected in the Legends of the Zone Trilogy to serve as a prequel of sorts to STALKER 2 . Other PS Plus Extra games for May 2025 include Five Nights At Freddy's: Help Wanted Full Time Edition, Gloomhaven Mercenaries Edition, Humankind, Soul Hackers 2, and Story of Seasons: A Wonderful Life .

PS Plus May 2025 Games

Essential Tier

  • Ark: Survival Ascended
  • Balatro
  • Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun

Extra Tier

  • Battlefield 5
  • Five Nights At Freddy's: Help Wanted Full Time Edition
  • Gloomhaven: Mercenaries Edition
  • Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising
  • Humankind
  • Sand Land
  • Soul Hackers 2
  • S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Legends of the Zone Trilogy
  • Story of Seasons: A Wonderful Life

Premium Tier

  • Battle Engine Aqulia

Additions to the Premium-tier catalog tend to take the form of classic pre-PS4 titles available via the exclusive game streaming feature. This month's addition is Battle Engine Aquila , a somewhat obscure mech action game that has players piloting a massive, towering Battle Engine robot across a teeming battlefield full of enemy soldiers and vehicles to destroy. Like other games with transforming mecha, the Battle Engine can transition between a walking mech mode and flying jet mode, with multiple battle engine types that accommodate different play styles.

Earlier in the month, some PS Plus subscribers were disappointed to learn that a whopping 22 games will leave the PS Plus game catalog on May 20, including a number of first-party Sony games like Resistance 2 and Infamous Second Son . Other classics like Batman: Arkham Knight, Grand Theft Auto 5 , and even VR-exclusive titles like The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners are getting removed from the subscription catalog on that day, and will need to be purchased to play.

PS Plus Extra/Premium Games Leaving May 2025

  • Batman: Arkham Knight
  • Before Your Eyes
  • Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night
  • Enter the Gungeon
  • Ghostbusters: Rise of the Ghost Lord
  • Ghostrunner
  • Grand Theft Auto 5
  • Infamous: Second Son
  • Journey to the Savage Planet
  • LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2
  • MotoGP 24
  • Payday 2: Crimewave Edition
  • Portal Knights
  • Resistance: Fall of Man
  • Resistance 2
  • Stranded: Alien Dawn
  • Synth Riders
  • The LEGO Movie 2 Video Game
  • The Sims 4: Island Living
  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners
  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners - Chapter 2: Retribution
  • Walkabout Mini Golf

After May 20, PS Plus subscribers should look forward to the end of the month, around May 28, as that will be the next likely reveal of the June 2025 batch of PS Plus free games. Once detailed, those games should become accessible on June 3, the first Tuesday of the month.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 - 8 Things To Do Before Going To NG+
item.description:
After completing the story in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , players may be inclined to replay the game through the New Game+ feature. This allows players to relive their journey from the very beginning, but with most of the items they have already collected in their previous playthroughs.

There are a lot of reasons to do an NG+ run in a game like Expedition 33 , like looking for more challenges, wanting to experience a different ending or relationship, wishing to experiment with different builds, or striving to understand the lore better through crumbs thrown inside the dialogues. No matter the reason, here's an NG+ checklist in Expedition 33 for players who are considering restarting their expedition.

8 Unlock All Gradient Skills

Gommage At Will

Gradient Skills are one of the strongest abilities an expeditioner can have in Expedition 33 . It ranges from pure damage to supportive, and they're all great. When players first learn about Gradient Skills, it's likely just something they do whenever available, but in the end-game, there are a lot of Luminas that can maximize the team's Gradient Charge quickly. This allows powerful Skills like Lune's Sky Break and Maelle's Gommage to be cast constantly.

Although not the best in terms of damage, Monoco's Break Point is excellent at providing a safe run against hard-hitting bosses, even one as powerful as Simon in Expedition 33 ​​​​​​.

7 Collect Pictos And Upgrade Them Into Luminas

One-Shot Enemies Four Times

Pictos and Luminas are the core of a character's build in Expedition 33 , that's why it's great to know that these are carried over to NG+. There are a lot of niche Luminas in the game, but overpowered ones like Cheater and Energy Master are easily a must-get.

Although players will get the Pictos again at a higher level in their New Game Plus run, collecting them in the first playthrough will allow players to build their team immediately, and they can get comfortable fighting enemies in the new game.

6 Find All The Weapons

For The Gustave Who Comes After

Like Pictos and Luminas, players will also get weapons at a higher level in their NG+ run. However, having access to late-game weapons in an early-game setting allows players to experiment with a larger variety of builds. Gustave shares the same weapon as Verso, so the equipment you collect for Verso in the previous playthrough will be available for Gustave in NG+. Sadly, the weapons won't have an additional passive for Gustave. A foreshadowing that many players missed.

Another thing worth collecting before NG+ is Perfect Chroma Catalyst , which allows a weapon to reach the max level of 33. They can be farmed more easily in NG+, but if players wish to start their playthrough with a max-level weapon, then it's best to collect the available Perfect Chroma Catalyst before moving on to NG+.

5 Collect Outfits And Hairstyles

Baguette Mode In Prologue

During NG+, the available expeditioners will immediately be available in the Prologue, even Monoco. This makes the first walk in Lumiere quite funny, since the characters will follow the players around, like they normally do while exploring. Pair this with the fact that the outfits and hairstyles you collect will carry on in the New Game Plus, and you can have a Baguette team at the start of the Prologue.

Of course, this is just for laughs, and it can be amusing for players who turn on the "Character Customisation In Cutscenes" option.

4 Collect The Nevron Feet

Why Are They So Pointy?

Since Monoco will be available as soon as you start NG+, it's a good idea to collect all Monoco's skills in Expedition 33 . Although it seems like a chore, completing Monoco's abilities can actually be done naturally, as long as players use Monoco from when they first got him.

It's understandable if players steered clear of Monoco when they first got him, but those who bear with the Gestral will soon find themselves having a true jack-of-all-trades. Monoco can buff, debuff, heal, protect, deal massive damage (both AoE and single-target), and break. Whatever role players need, Monoco can fill it.

3 Build Your Party Members

...Or Don't

NG+ promises a tougher bunch of enemies, so it's a good idea to prepare a good build for your team in Expedition 33 . This is especially true for players who wish to test Gustave with end-game items, where experimenting on Verso allows for Gustave to be built early.

However, the game may be too easy if players are overprepared before NG+. In this case, players seeking more challenge can try nerfing their own characters, switching to expert difficulty, or using a mod that increases the enemy's HP.

2 Find The Journals

Relive The Story, But With More Context

Considering there's not much change in the gameplay during NG+, players may be interested in doing a new playthrough to get a better grasp of the lore. Small details from cryptic dialogue would make more sense once players understand the context of the story.

Therefore, players who are doing NG+ for the lore should definitely hunt down all the journals before attempting a new playthrough. This will provide more context about previous expeditioners, on top of unique figures such as Simon, Julie, and the members of the Dessendre family. As a reward for collecting all these journals in Expedition 33 , players will also get the Follow the Trail trophy.

Journals are not carried to NG+.

1 Prepare Enough Time For The Prologue

From A Mime To The Life Enjoyer

Although it looks like a plain intro, there are a lot of collectibles available in the Prologue, including an outfit and a Music Record. Therefore, if players previously rushed through it, they should take some time to walk around the Gommage festival in their NG+ playthrough.

Those who didn't get the Prologue's Music Record, Lumiere , will have a second chance to get the music later, but they will still miss the A Peculiar Encounter trophy for not beating the Mime.

Players who missed out on the Festival Tokens in their first Expedition 33 playthrough can also explore the event thoroughly to obtain all the stall rewards.

10 Images
10 Images

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Pokemon TCG Fan Shares Incredible Gen 1 Collection
item.description:
Summary

  • A Pokemon TCG fan shared an impressive 17-page binder collection featuring Kanto monsters in English and Japanese.
  • Kanto Pokemon were first introduced in the 1999 Base Set, with new sets like Fossil and Jungle released soon after.
  • Fans frequently share diverse Pokemon TCG collections on social media.

A Pokemon Trading Card Game fan has shared an impressive collection of Gen 1 cards. Pokemon Trading Card Game keeps players entertained with new expansions and sets released every year.

The Pokemon from Kanto were introduced in the Base Set, the first Pokemon Trading Card Game expansion released worldwide in 1999. Pikachu and friends got more new sets in the same year, with the release of Fossil and Jungle. In 2000, the Kanto generation was again featured with the release of the Base Set 2, Team Rocket, Gym Heroes, and Gym Challenge expansions. Showing their affection for this nostalgic group of characters, a Pokemon Trading Card Game fan shared an impressive collection.

On the Pokemon TCG subreddit, user JSvntl showed off an incredible collection of cards from all the Kantonian monsters. They say they started the collection with their daughter without necessarily focusing on chase cards, and the result is a 17-page binder with cards in English and Japanese. Some are worth highlighting, such as Pikachu and Bulbasaur from the Base Set, both with illustrations by Mitsuhiro Arita. Other eye-catchers include Dark Kadabra, a card of the Psychic-type Pokemon featured in the Team Rocket set, and the Slowpoke, Beedrill, Ditto, Dragonite, and Mew full art cards. The comments on the publication praised the collection the OP and their daughter got, with one Redditor saying they liked the mix of new and old cards.

Pokemon Trading Card Game Inspires Fans to Create the Most Diverse Collections

The selection of cards shown by JSvntl is one of several collections that Pokemon TCG fans frequently share on social media. Previously, one fan showcased an incredible collection of Charizard cards, including some highly coveted copies of the Fire-type Pokemon. A second fan surprised the community by sharing a collection of Pokemon cards with surprisingly violent illustrations. A third fan showed off their wife's series of Pokemon cards, including several Shadowless cards of monsters such as Nidoking and Gyarados.

In addition to the classic cards, fans who want to add new copies of the Kanto monsters can purchase set 151. Released in 2023, it celebrates the first generation with 207 new cards in English. For those who want to add to their collection with cards from other generations, one of the upcoming releases will be the Destined Rivals set, which hits shelves on May 30. The second will be Black Bolt and White Flare, a Pokemon TCG expansion coming out on June 1 with cards focusing on the Pokemon featured in Gen 5.

item.title: 8 Most Fun Western RPGs, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • The journey in Western RPGs features engaging moments and challenges to keep players entertained.
  • Pillars of Eternity offers chaotic combat and a fun narrative structure for CRPG enthusiasts.
  • Disco Elysium's writing elevates the fun factor to new heights, making it one of the best video games ever made.

Western RPGs continue to be some of the most talked-about and in-demand games for fans. Players love the idea of embarking on grand adventures with massive stakes that prompt them to take on tough foes and survive by the skin of their teeth.

This setup alone makes for some of the most fun and engaging video games that fans can get their hands on. Players who check out these Western RPGs will find themselves struggling to remember moments when they were bored.

8 Pillars Of Eternity

A Modern CRPG With A Fun Narrative Structure And Chaotic Combat

Pillars of Eternity
7.3 /10
Released
March 26, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Paradox Interactive, Versus Evil
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

While the sequel may be better from a gameplay standpoint, players who want to enjoy a polished and engaging CRPG with amazing writing will love what Pillars of Eternity brings to the table. It's one of the most important video games that helped usher in the CRPG genre's revival, along with various other titles that were released around the same time.

Controlling the Watcher, amassing a group of heroes, exploring the bowels of Caed Nua, and enjoying a grand adventure where players go against the very gods of the world is a blast. The real-time combat is accommodating while also letting veterans enjoy a challenge at higher difficulties, and The White March gives players another reason to spend time in this unique world.

7 Disco Elysium

The Writing Elevates This Game's Fun Factor To New Heights

Disco Elysium
9 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
12
9.6 /10

Developer(s)
ZA/UM
Publisher(s)
ZA/UM
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Disco Elysium is one of the greatest video games ever made, with players loving the adventures of Raphael Ambrosius Costeau (not his real name, by the way), who teams up with one of the best companions in RPG history, Detective Kim Kitsuragi.

The humor of the game's writing, coupled with its many imaginative scenarios, ensures that players will have a great time powering through Disco Elysium . The game pulls no punches when it comes to its high points, letting players have some great fun with a narrative that is both zany and deeply thoughtful.

6 Dragon Age: Origins

A Generational RPG With Immense Role-Playing Options

Dragon Age: Origins
9 /10
14
9.4 /10
Released
November 3, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
14
9.4 /10

Developer(s)
BioWare
Publisher(s)
Electronic Arts
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

Dragon Age: Origins is one of the greatest Western RPGs of all time — there's no denying that. The game's six unique origins, along with some strong worldbuilding in a dark fantasy world, ensure that players will remember the grand setting of Dragon Age , which manages to avoid quite a few generic tropes in its bid to create a living, breathing world built upon many classic elements of the fantasy genre.

The unique origin system itself ensures that players can enjoy multiple replays of this title, and it helps that the extensive role-playing options guarantee unique dialogue and moments throughout this epic journey. Seeing an unlikely protagonist become the Hero of Ferelden makes for a grand tale that fans can't get enough of.

5 Baldur's Gate 3

One Of The Greatest Modern RPGs Of All Time

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
130
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
9 /10
130
9.7 /10

Developer(s)
Larian Studios
Publisher(s)
Larian Studios
Platform(s)
PC, macOS, PS5, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Baldur's Gate 3 is perhaps the greatest modern RPG of all time. The slow pace of the turn-based combat can take a while to get used to, but players who move past this issue will find themselves enjoying a generational Western RPG that puts the works of most profit-focused AAA companies to shame.

The sheer amount of unique content in this game is mind-boggling and shows just how much work Larian put into making a player's role-playing choices matter. Every playthrough in this game feels different, and players can clock in almost a thousand hours if they want to try every build, story path, and mod in existence for this title.

4 Mass Effect 2

The Peak Of The Mass Effect Series And Commander Shepard's Adventures

Mass Effect 2
8 /10
9.2 /10
Released
January 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
8 /10
9.2 /10

Developer(s)
BioWare
Publisher(s)
Electronic Arts
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

Mass Effect 2 is the peak of this franchise, upping the stakes as Shepard reluctantly works for the Illusive Man and his black-ops terrorist organization, Cerberus, in a bid to stop the collectors and the impending threat of the reapers. This journey also comes with some of the most compelling side character storylines in the genre, with each companion fleshing out the world alongside the main story's development.

The improved gameplay and high-stakes missions ensure that fans will be thoroughly entertained throughout this experience. The writing is another highlight in this title, as players get invested in the act of being a Paragon or Renegade as they strive to secure the future of life in the Milky Way Galaxy.

3 Fallout: New Vegas

Every Corner Of This World Is Brimming With Memorable Encounters

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
20
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10
20
8.9 /10

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Bethesda
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

There's something about Fallout: New Vegas that keeps fans coming back for more. Being shot in the head makes for a tantalizing intro, as the Courier is brought back to life, prompting an adventure for the ages where players head to New Vegas and get embroiled in a grand plan to gain control of the city.

The amazing world design, extensive role-playing options, amazing writing, and a bevy of iconic characters ensure that players can invest hours upon hours in New Vegas without getting bored. Every corner of the world hides a tantalizing secret, and the game's DLCs are some of the best pieces of additional content released for a video game.

2 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt's Adventures End On A Very High Note

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
46
9.4 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION

9 /10

9.4 /10

Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Publisher(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Geralt is one of the greatest protagonists of all time, and fans can't help but sympathize with this character's hunt to find Ciri. However, that won't stop them from being distracted by the game's massive world as they find an endless stream of meaningful content to sink their teeth into.

Almost every side quest in the game boasts incredible writing that either rivals or exceeds the quality of the main story. The combat seems deceptively simple but opens up at higher difficulties, keeping players invested in its layered systems. This ensures that Geralt's adventures will never cease to be entertaining as players explore a massive world in The Witcher 3 .

1 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

The Greatest And Most Engaging Elder Scrolls Game Ever Made

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
70

November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

Publisher(s)
Bethesda Softworks
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

There's something about Skyrim 's wonderful freedom and immersion that keeps fans coming back for more. Bethesda's magnum opus was such a massive success for the company that it allowed it to reach greater heights and become a major player in the industry.

Even after the many years that have passed, all players need to do is download a few mods, and they'll be set for yet another hundred-hour adventure in the Nordic lands of Skyrim. The sheer amount of content in this game is mind-boggling and will keep players busy and entertained for a very long time.

item.title: 6 Best Sci-fi RPGs Of The 2000s, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Anachronox is an underrated sci-fi RPG with an imaginative world, turn-based gameplay, and excellent storytelling.
  • Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic 2 offers a nuanced story with complex characters and deep exploration of the Force.
  • Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 expands Zack Fair's journey before the main game, combining emotional storytelling and sci-fi elements.

Science fiction is a captivating genre that many movies, TV shows, and comics have made the most out of. Video games are no exception here, with many quality role-playing games allowing players to explore tantalizing sci-fi worlds complete with complex decision-making and enthralling characters.

The 2000s were a great time to see the rise of sci-fi RPGs as they became more mainstream. This decade may not have seen too many quality games in the sci-fi RPG genre, but the RPGs that did end up standing out are beloved by the masses for whisking them away on grand interplanetary adventures.

6 Anachronox

A Western Take On The Turn-Based Genre That's Pretty Unique

3 Images
3 Images
Anachronox
RPG
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
June 27, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ion Storm
Publisher(s)
Eidos Interactive, Infogrames
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Anachronox is easily one of the most underrated video games of all time. The fact that barely anyone talks about this title despite its imaginative world, fun turn-based gameplay, excellent storytelling, and generational music is nothing short of a crime.

From the very moment players step into this sci-fi epic, they'll form a bond with its characters while slowly coming to grips with the gameplay. It may be showing its age now, but fans who don't mind tinkering with the game files to optimize the experience will love just how riveting this title is.

5 Star Wars Knights Of The Old Republic 2: The Sith Lords

Obsidian Sequel Is So Good Some People Consider It To Be Better Than KOTOR 1

Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic 2: The Sith Lords
8.8 /10
Released
December 6, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment, Aspyr
Publisher(s)
LucasArts
Platform(s)
Switch, Xbox (Original), Windows, iOS, Linux, macOS, Android
Powered by

If this game had achieved its grand scope and shipped without any bugs, there would be a genuine debate about whether Knights of the Old Republic 2 is better than its sequel. While The Sith Lords Restored Content Modification does help this game feel whole again, one can't justify ranking this game higher because of fan efforts.

Knights of the Old Republic 2 boasts one of the more nuanced stories told in a piece of Star Wars media, finally letting fans experience how riveting a discussion about the Force can be when things aren't treated as black and white. This sentiment is displayed via interactions with Kreia, who is easily one of the greatest Star Wars characters of all time.

4 Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7

This Prequel Expands On Zack Fair's Riveting Story Before The Events Of The Main Game

Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7
Action RPG
Systems
Released
March 24, 2008
ESRB
Teen // Blood, Mild Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix

Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PlayStation Portable
Powered by

Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 is one of the best prequel games of all time, detailing Zack Fair's journey as a SOLDIER. He met several important figures from the main game in the process, including Cloud, Sephiroth, and Hojo.

Final Fantasy 7 's world is decidedly more sci-fi than other games in the series, and Crisis Core lets players explore Midgar and Shinra in a way they never had before. It helps that the emotional storytelling will make fans cry at the end of a wonderful experience.

3 Star Wars: Knights Of The Old Republic

BioWare's Take On A Star Wars Game Is In A Class Of Its Own

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
10
9.0 /10
Released
July 15, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Publisher(s)
LucasArts
Platform(s)
Xbox (Original), iOS, Android, Switch, PC, macOS
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

BioWare had already established itself as a master of the Western RPG genre with the Baldur's Gate games. This success allowed them to use bigger budgets to make their game more cinematic, and the fact that they got their hands on the valuable Star Wars IP was a sign of the new heights they would achieve as a studio.

When Knights of the Old Republic came out, fans were treated to what is still the best Star Wars game ever made. The story is easily the game's strongest element, delivering one of the most legendary video game plot twists of all time that fans can't stop talking about (much to the detriment of fans who haven't played this game but have already been spoiled).

2 Mass Effect

Players Were Introduced To Commander Shepard And The Compelling Mass Effect Universe

Mass Effect
13
8.0 /10
Released
November 20, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Publisher(s)
Electronic Arts
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

After the success of Dragon Age: Origins , it seemed that BioWare could do no wrong. Even when they started prioritizing action combat over tactical battles, fans knew that this studio had the talent to make compelling role-playing games with this gameplay loop.

This sentiment was reinforced with the release of Mass Effect , one of the best sci-fi RPGs of all time that laid the groundwork for something special. While its sequel may be revered as a major improvement in almost every way, that should take nothing away from the greatness of the first game, which set into motion one of the greatest sci-fi trilogies in the history of role-playing games.

1 Deus Ex

An Immersive Sim RPG That Takes Place In A Unique Sci-fi Setting

6 Images
6 Images
Deus Ex
6.7 /10
Released
June 23, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ion Storm
Publisher(s)
Eidos Interactive
Platform(s)
PlayStation 2, PC
Powered by

With a little bit of cyberpunk and sci-fi elements, fans fell in love with the dystopian world of Deus Ex in no time. It helped that the immersive sim gameplay was in a class of its own and proved why Warren Spector deserves to be hailed as one of the greatest minds in the video game industry.

Deus Ex is one of the few action RPGs that does justice to the latter half of this moniker. JC will genuinely feel inept in skills he hasn't trained in, with his aptitude becoming noticeably better as fans invest points to make this nano-augmented agent more capable than ever before.
